intro: Pedicularis henryi, commonly known as the Henry's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
